programmes.show_name: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programmes.show_description: Compilation of TV clangers featuring Anton Du Beke, Kate Garraway, Rob Rinder, Gethin Jones, Cat Deeley, Ryan Thomas, Bradley Walsh, the cast of McDonald and Dodds and more. Plus, Ant and Dec get into trouble when a pensioner hijacks a live broadcast. Tom Allen hosts

Action from the latest matches, including Coventry City v Stoke City at Coventry Building Society Arena, Portsmouth v Hull City at Fratton Park and Charlton Athletic v Wrexham at The Valley in the Championship

programmes.show_name: Devil in Disguise: John Wayne Gacy
programmes.show_description: A blizzard hits Chicago as Kozenczak finds Gacy's survivors - while he and Kunkle pressure Gacy's aide David Cram, Billy Carroll shows Dale Landingin the risks and rewards of sex work.
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host the semi-final as the amateur designers try to impress guest judge Lily Cole, with the model joining M&S lead designers and customers to decide who goes through to the final for the chance of winning the life-changing prize
James welcomes TV presenter Katie Piper and ITV Racing's Megan Nicholls to his home, while there are delicious recipes from chefs Lorna McNee and Michael Caines

Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by singer and Songs of Praise presenter Brenda Edwards for cooking, chat and craft. Shivi makes potato latkes with smoked salmon and wasabi sour cream for breakfast, as well as pineapple chicken enchiladas, while there is homemade mango body butter on offer. Jimmy has tips for apple picking and feeds his beloved pigs, while upcycling supremo Max McMurdo turns old pallets into a garden potting bench
A round-up of the latest headlines

programmes.show_name: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programmes.show_description: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are Ted Lasso star Hannah Waddingham, food writer Mary Berry and actor Michael Praed. Camilla Bassett-Smith champions award-winning plants, Jaega Wise looks at the ever-growing trend of pastry stouts, including a tiramisu-flavoured one, and Alan shines a light on the traditional skill of horse logging

After a year without pigs, Liz and Kelvin decide to reintroduce them to the farm and have chosen a crossbreed of Oxford sandy and blacks and saddlebacks for this occasion, with the children thrilled at the new sow and her 12 piglets. Liz's new range of blankets made from the wool sheared from their flock in the summer also arrive and she and Kelvin start hatching a plan to host their first farmers' market to sell them
Round-up of the latest headlines

programmes.show_name: Julia Bradbury's Wonders of the Frozen South
programmes.show_description: Julia Bradbury journeys to the edge of the world to experience the beauty and brutal conditions of Antarctica as she explores its icy landscapes and extraordinary wildlife. After crossing the Southern Ocean, Julia's boat is surrounded by penguins and seals before a pod of humpback whales finally breaks cover to breath and feed. Following an emotional overnight camp in Paradise Bay, Julia then experiences the raw power of nature thanks to a giant iceberg split

Ainsley Harriott tries his hand at straw-weaving before learning how to cook grouper Nassau-style, taking in a lesson in 'conch-servation' down at the Fish Fry, and following that up with rum punch chicken wings in his kitchen on the beach

Ant and Dec host as more performers take to the stage at the auditions in Blackpool, trying to impress judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and KSI and secure their place in the live semi-finals

Bradley Walsh presents as David James, Lucrezia Millarini, Myles Stephenson and Joe Suggn pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught
Round-up of the latest headlines

Rob Brydon hosts the semi-final as the 17 remaining contestants face another tense round of quick-fire quiz duels as they aim for a spot in the final. With a £5,000 Floor bonus on the line and a £50,000 jackpot up for grabs in next week's climax, it's all to play for as friends turn to foes and challenge one another

programmes.show_name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programmes.show_description: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with the four lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

Jane believes that marriage with boyfriend Tommy is just around the corner, but cracks soon appear in the relationship and a toxic pattern starts to emerge. Now living together, they try to integrate into each other's social circles, but some of their friends are disapproving of the relationship. Confronted with the sudden appearance of a ghost from her past at a party, Jane starts to unravel and a make-or-break holiday has disastrous consequences.
Round-up of the latest headlines

Detectives reinvestigate the murder of Carol Morgan in the storeroom of her Bedfordshire corner shop in 1981 - re-examining the files, revisiting the crime scene, and looking for new witnesses as previously missed evidence points to a different theory. Two new suspects are identified and brought in for questioning
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

After a year without pigs, Liz and Kelvin decide to reintroduce them to the farm and have chosen a crossbreed of Oxford sandy and blacks and saddlebacks for this occasion, with the children thrilled at the new sow and her 12 piglets. Liz's new range of blankets made from the wool sheared from their flock in the summer also arrive and she and Kelvin start hatching a plan to host their first farmers' market to sell them
Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features
Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.
A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions
Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective
The key headlines from the day so far
The fast-paced game of words hosted by Adil Ray - fighting it out this time are sisters Moina and Shazia, Ashleigh and her dad Brent, and couple Ian and Laura.

Ranvir Singh hosts the quiz as Randip and Harps, Rebecca and Ethan, and Miren and Jane take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis as they attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums. Only one team will make it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Bradley Walsh hosts as Lucy from Nottingham, Chris from Co Durham, Linda from Twickenham and Tom from Bedfordshire work as a team to take on one of the experts in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught
A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

The family puts pet lamb Aga in with the rest of the flock, and a couple of older lambs are the first to leave for market. Marnie and Milo make a birdbox and Kelvin is concerned the bad weather might ruin the harvest. Elsewhere, it's another first as the family sets up a stall at the Cheshire Show in an attempt to sell produce to the public
Bear finds himself getting into further trouble, while Cain feels he is at the end of his tether and Arthur is fearful.

Jane's fairy tale falls apart when she finds herself at the centre of a police investigation, but she reconnects with an old friend from palace life whose unexpected support gives her hope. Back in London, Jane faces trial at the Old Bailey, but as the prosecution and defence battle it out Jane starts to lose her grip on reality and makes a shocking allegation when she takes to the stand. What will the jury decide?
A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents
Current affairs show tackling the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective, with studio debate and analysis of major stories
